result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kito Ronel Hunt was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to case# 15CT485, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

Defendant's driver operating privileges are REVOKED for a period of 24 months.
Defendant is not to operate any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 24 months.

miscConds.notes:
PAY fine in the amount of $600.00 - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With release privileges for child care, employment, and Day Reporting Center purposes only.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kito Ronel Hunt in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Defendant Kito Ronel Hunt in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by defendant's girlfriend, Cammille K.


AS TO COUNT 1:    Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS, consecutive to case# 15CT485, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS. 
Credit given "administratively" for 102 days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* SERVE 11 MONTHS "condition time" at the House of Correction with release privileges for child care, employment, and Day Reporting Center purposes only.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY fine in the amount of $600.00 - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant's driver operating privileges are REVOKED for a period of 24 months.
* Defendant is not to operate any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
* Any vehicle titled in the defendant's name or driven by the defendant is to have an ignition interlock device installed for a period of 24 months.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Defendant Kito Ronel Hunt in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Defendant Kito Ronel Hunt in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 and Count #3 dismissed outright.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

ADDRESS INFO for Kito Ronel Hunt
Current: PO Box 90246, Milwaukee, WI 53209-0246 United States  (Effective: 06-10-2015)
Prior: 817 East Glendale Avenue   Apt 3, Shorewood, WI 53211

Attorney John J. Forrestal in court, defendant Kito Ronel Hunt not in court, in custody.  
Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  This Court to accept misdemeanor case 15CT485 as part of a global resolution before Branch 02. 
Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kito Ronel Hunt in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Defendant Kito Ronel Hunt in custody.  Ronald Dague for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kito Ronel Hunt in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Kito Ronel Hunt in custody.  Ronald Dague for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kito Ronel Hunt in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Kito Ronel Hunt in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Court entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3 on behalf of the Defendant.   DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
